content.description: Project - Sit start with left hand on decent pinch low on the left arete, right on marginal crimper. Pull on and throw for good incut gaston on right side of face,  then work to top of boulder.

Sit start with your hands on a large jug low on the right side of the arete, almost where it meets the birch tree. Your feet will have a nice rail pretty low, and almost close to where the boulder meets the exposed water. Slap up to a decent right hand sloping crimp (crux) and reach high to a rounded edge for your left. Crank up jugs to the top.  

  Crawling from a just above a puddle to topping out upright on two legs is quite the evolution!
content.location: This route is located on the Swamp Boulder, the smaller boulder you will see on the way to the cut boulder.

content.description: Starting on the left corner/side of the Swamp Boulder with a foot on the back wall in the pocket, work your way up the left side/arête, to a throw for the good crimp on the left side of the overhanging face. Tension and then dynamic. Crappy rock quality but none the less fun. Cleaned a bunch of moss off the holds so maybe an FA.
This boulder is located directly behind the small swamp and will be the first boulder you come to headed to the Cut Boulder.
